Title: TYF slams Lamido, warns against distorting June 12 history
Summary: Think Yoruba Organisation First (TYF) Worldwide has strongly condemned former Governor Sule Lamido’s comments on the June 12 struggle . TYF accuses Lamido of rewriting history and denying credit to key figures who risked their lives for democracy . In a statement released by the organisation, TYF warns against distorting June 12 history

Title: 10th Senate midterm: Bamidele highlights progress, sets reform agenda
Summary: Senator Opeyemi Bamidele has used the occasion to reflect on the legislature's achievements so far and outline its forward-looking agenda . The Ekiti Senator, who represents Ekiti, said Nigeria commemorates 26 years of uninterrupted democracy .

Title: Tinubu commissions over 9,000 agricultural equipment
Summary: Tinubu commissioned over 9,000 agricultural mechanization equipment . The equipment is part of the Federal Government’s Renewed Hope Agricultural Mechanization Programme . The programme aims to transform Nigeria's agriculture sector and achieve food sovereignty .

Title: Imo CP cautions recruits against abetting local crimes
Summary: Imo State Police Commissioner, CP Aboki Danjuma, issued the warning while addressing 264 recruits . Newly recruited police officers from Imo and Abia states were warned not to indulge in activities that will encourage crimes or promote violence in their communities .

Title: Port Regulatory Agency Bill will curb trouble makers, protect investments — NIS DG
Summary: Port Regulatory Agency Bill will prevent troublemakers from infiltrating the nation’s port system and damaging the economy . The Director-General of the Nigerian Shippers’ Council (NSC) Pius Akuta said the bill will prevent non-professionals and troublemakers .

Title: BREAKING: Iran attacks US military bases in Qatar, Iraq
Summary: Iran has reportedly fired six missiles at US bases in Qatar and Iraq, retaliating against the bombing of its nuclear sites by the US military . The missiles were reportedly fired at US military bases in Doha and Iraq .

Title: Benue bleeds, Plateau suffers, Zamfara burns— Ejiofor weeps over rising insecurity despite Tinubu’s visits
Summary: Prominent human rights activist and legal practitioner, Sir Ifeanyi Ejiofor, has expressed deep sorrow and outrage over the rising violence in Nigeria . He lamented that the situation has persisted despite recent visits by President Bola Ahmed Tinubu to affected areas .

Title: Food security: Tinubu distributes 2000 tractors to states to boost agriculture
Summary: Tinubu commissioned 2,000 tractors for nationwide deployment under the Renewed Hope Agricultural Mechanisation Programme . He declared that Nigeria's agricultural renaissance has begun as he commissioned the tractors on Monday in Abuja .

Title: Man, 31, arrested in Edo for allegedly killing, burying missing girlfriend in shallow grave
Summary: Joshua Osaigbovo, 31, arrested in Edo for allegedly killing, burying missing girlfriend in shallow grave . Osato Edogiaweria, 21, was declared missing in April 2025 .

Title: Police urge Anambra residents to expose criminals
Summary: Police Command in Anambra has urged residents of the state to expose criminals among them . The Police Command urges residents to maintain law and order, prevent crimes .

Title: Africa must lead its climate, infrastructure agenda – Akume
Summary: The Secretary to the Government of the Federation, George Akume, said Africa must position itself not as a passive recipient of solutions but as an active architect of its sustainable development . Akume said the Bi/Multilateral Africa Infrastructure and Climate Change Summit 2025 offers a timely platform for the continent to articulate and activate collaborative strategies for resilient infrastructure and

Title: Tinubu to establish ranches in Abuja community
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has stated that his administration will work with rural farmers and livestock owners in Pai community, to establish ranches, and uplift the lives of the people . He made she statement on Monday, while inaugurating the newly constructed A2 junction (from Abuja-Lokoja Expressway to Pai road

Title: Edo man kills, buries girlfriend in shallow grave
Summary: The Edo State Police Command has arrested one Joshua Osaigbovo, 31, in connection with the death of his girlfriend, Osato Festus Edogiaweria, 21, whose disappearance was reported in April 2025 . The case was subsequently transferred to the State Criminal Investigations Department for further action in a demonstration of the Command

Title: Widows not property, should not be shared by relatives - CAN
Summary: The Niger State chapter of the Christian Association of Nigeria has called on families to stop sharing widows, saying they are not properties . The Chairman of the Niger State CAN, Most Rev. Dr. Bulus Yohanna, made the call on Monday during his felicitation on the International Day of the widows . He admonished

Title: Obidient Movement raises funds for Peter Obi’s 64th birthday rally
Summary: The Obidient Movement has announced plans for a nationwide rally to celebrate the 64th birthday of former Anambra State governor Peter Obi . The group said four dedicated bank accounts had been created to fund the rally activities, which is jointly mangaged by three individuals named, Serah Ibrahim, Ezeokoli Blessing, and John Al
